intro: Psydrax schimperianus, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces, and it produces small, spherical fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and public spaces.
